sections.title: Prescriber-led facial aesthetics with clear boundaries
sections.body: Use this hub to explore anti-wrinkle care, dermal fillers, skin boosters, and polynucleotides already available at Shoreham-by-Sea. Every pathway is assessment-led, safety-first, and delivered with medical oversight.
bullets: Suitability checks and consent before any treatment
Measured, conservative dosing aligned to facial anatomy
Transparent guidance on aftercare and when not to proceed

sections.title: Medical framing, not trend-led promises
items: Full medical history, medicines, and skin review before prescribing
Only regulated products with aseptic technique and complication protocols
Clear discussion of limitations—no guarantees of cosmetic outcomes
Review and cooling-off encouraged; you can pause at any point

sections.title: Understand each treatment option
sections.body: We compare the available facial aesthetic treatments, explain when each is appropriate, and outline when to avoid treatment. If a clinical review suggests a different route—such as skincare or no intervention—we explain why.
bullets: Prescription anti-wrinkle treatments for specific expression lines (/treatments/anti-wrinkle-treatments)
Dermal fillers for conservative contour or support when clinically appropriate (/treatments/dermal-fillers)
Skin boosters to improve hydration and surface quality (/treatments/skin-boosters)
Polynucleotides to support skin conditioning where suitable (/treatments/polynucleotides)
What not to treat: contraindications, unrealistic aims, or requests outside medical scope

sections.title: Patients seeking measured, clinician-led aesthetics
items: Those wanting careful softening of expression lines with prescription oversight
Patients considering modest volume support without chasing dramatic change
People focused on skin texture and hydration under medical supervision
Anyone who values clear limits on outcomes and honest advice when not to proceed

sections.title: Consult, plan, treat carefully, review
items: Initial consultation with medical screening and photographs if helpful
Agree a conservative plan across the relevant treatment types
Treatment delivered with regulated products and sterile, documented technique
Aftercare and review to monitor comfort, symmetry, and safety
Pause, adjust, or stop if preferences or suitability change
sections.strapline: There is no obligation to continue—treatment only proceeds when safe and clinically justified.

faqs.question: Do I need a prescription for anti-wrinkle treatment?
faqs.answer: Yes. A prescriber assesses you first, confirms suitability, and issues a prescription before treatment.

faqs.question: Can I combine treatments?
faqs.answer: Only when clinically appropriate and sequenced safely. We explain how treatments interact, what maintenance looks like, and when to stage or avoid combinations.

faqs.question: What if I’m not suitable?
faqs.answer: We will explain why and may recommend skincare, dental care, or no treatment. There is no pressure to proceed.

faqs.question: How do you manage risks?
faqs.answer: We use regulated products, aseptic technique, and have emergency protocols, including dissolving agents for filler-related complications.

sections.title: Book a facial aesthetics consultation
sections.strapline: Discuss anti-wrinkle care, dermal fillers, skin boosters, or polynucleotides with a prescriber who prioritises safety and realism.
